description: From German Sapropel, corresponding to sapro- + Ancient Greek πηλός (pēlós, “mud, clay”).

entries.meaning: (geology) An aquatic sludge-like sediment rich in organic matter formed in oxygen-free areas at the bottom of lakes, seas etc.
examples: Another instance in which Mediterranean sapropels have provided clues about events deep within the African continent is the ‘greening’ of the Sahara about 120,000 years ago.
